title.narrative: Building Strong and Effective Impact Investing Industry

description.narrative: The Global Impact Investing Network (GIIN) is dedicated to increasing the scale and effectiveness of impact investing around the world. Funding from the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs supports the GIIN’s market-building initiatives to mobilize capital for impact investing globally; safeguard the integrity of impact investing; and fuel the global impact investing movement to change mindsets about the role of capital in society. Through its initiatives, the GIIN builds critical infrastructure and supports activities, education, and research that help accelerate the development of a coherent impact investing industry. The ultimate aim of the GIIN’s work is to drive meaningful progress towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals—realizing the full potential of impact investing to combat entrenched poverty, gender inequality, climate change, lack of access to basic services, environmental degradation, and other critical global challenges.

job-title.narrative: Associate Director, Partnerships Management and Donor Relations

title.narrative: Percent of institutional asset owners (IAOs) surveyed who indicate that the GIIN’s work influenced their plans to continue pursuing impact investing
Percent of institutional asset owners (IAOs) surveyed who indicate that the GIIN’s work influenced their plans to continue pursuing impact investing

description.narrative: The data for the GIIN’s Institutional Asset Owner engagement activities was collected through a combination of live rapid surveys during events/webinars and/or post-event follow-up surveys. As such, these results reflect data collected only from participants who responded to surveys.

comment.narrative: 91% of IAO survey respondents indicated likelihood of continued exploration of impact investing.

title.narrative: Percent of institutional asset owners (IAOs) surveyed who indicate that the GIIN’s work generated new insights and/or ideas on how to apply an impact lens to their investment portfolios
Percent of institutional asset owners (IAOs) surveyed who indicate that the GIIN’s work generated new insights and/or ideas on how to apply an impact lens to their investment portfolios

description.narrative: The data for the GIIN’s Institutional Asset Owner engagement activities was collected through a combination of live rapid surveys during events/webinars and/or post-event follow-up surveys. As such, these results reflect data collected only from participants who responded to surveys.

comment.narrative: 94% of IAO survey respondents indicated that the GIIN’s work informed their understanding of impact investing practice and/or strategy.

title.narrative: Number of non-GIIN articles published mentioning research report and/or data from report within six months after report is released
Number of non-GIIN articles published mentioning research report and/or data from report within six months after report is released

comment.narrative: 23 articles mentioned GIIN research reports and/or data from the reports within six months after publication: · Impact Investing Decision-making: Insights on Financial Performance - 11 mentions · Understanding Impact Performance: Climate Change Mitigation Investments and Quality Jobs Investments - 5 mentions · Institutional Asset Owners: Approaches to setting social and environmental goals - 4 mentions · COMPASS: The Methodology for Comparing and Assessing Impact - 3 mentions

title.narrative: Number of unique users who engage with new IRIS+ investment themes within one year of launch
Number of unique users who engage with new IRIS+ investment themes within one year of launch

comment.narrative: 3,498 unique users engaged with new IRIS+ investment themes (Sustainable Forestry, Sustainable Water Management, Access to Quality Education, Climate Change Mitigation, Quality Jobs, and Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH)) within one year of launch. • Access to Quality Education - 1,208 users • Climate Change Mitigation - 998 users • Quality Jobs - 839 users • Sustainable Water Management - 188 users • Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) - 138 users • Sustainable Forestry - 127 users

title.narrative: Number of institutional asset owners (IAOs) engaged in dedicated GIIN activities
Number of institutional asset owners engaged in dedicated GIIN activities

comment.narrative: 33 large global IAOs participated in the GIIN’s IAO roundtable series on integrating an impact lens throughout the investment process.

title.narrative: Number of GIIN-led events that took place in a developing country
Number of GIIN-led events that took place in a developing country

comment.narrative: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the GIIN did not hold in-person events in 2021.

title.narrative: Number of downloads of GIIN research publications from the GIIN website within six months after report is released
Number of downloads of GIIN research publications from the GIIN website within six months after report is released

comment.narrative: In 2021, the GIIN produced five research publications, which received a total of 7,641 unique downloads within six months after publication: · Impact Investing Decision-making: Insights on Financial Performance - 3,345 downloads within six months · COMPASS: The Methodology for Comparing and Assessing Impact - 2,045 downloads · Institutional Asset Owners: Approaches to setting social and environmental goals - 1,078 downloads · Understanding Impact Performance: Climate Change Mitigation Investments - 710 downloads · Understanding Impact Performance: Quality Jobs Investments - 463 downloads

title.narrative: Percentage of growth in number of unique user accounts for IRIS+
Percentage of growth in number of unique user accounts for IRIS+

comment.narrative: In 2021, the number of unique user accounts for IRIS+ increased by 63% compared to 2020 (from 14,672 to 23,938).

Number of GIIN speaking roles at prominent industry events

comment.narrative: The GIIN participated in 58 key industry events as a keynote speaker, panelist, and presenter.
